name: Adante Hotel

reviews.title: Lets be fair here
reviews.text: I was happy with my stay at the Adante. Small rooms? Sure, but most European Style Hotels have smaller rooms. Despite the claims of paper thin walls I heard nothing from my neighbors in my whole stay. Sketchy neighborhood? Not really. I traveled alone and I never felt unsafe. However I did take a cab late (After Midnight) at night as to not be waiting at or walking from bus stops alone. During the day its perfectly fine. Going west of that block while alone, at night might not be ideal, but walking to and from Union Square is not big deal.

reviews.title: Great Value!
reviews.text: Remember what you are paying in comparision to the other on shared bathroom hotels in the area. it isn't a five star and it doesn't bill itself as such. These are all things one needs to keep in mind. My only complaint if you can even call it that is that housekeeping makes it rounds rather early. My advice is if you go out to enjoy the night life, make sure you put your DND sign up before crawling into bed.

The staff has always been super helpful and nice. Even before my stay I called with questions, and they were very happy to answer them. They helped me figure out MUNi route and find bus stops and other little things that made my stay much better. I am returning to the Adante next month and I am looking forward to another positive experience.
reviews.title: Got stuck in the elevator
Good deal for the price
reviews.text: Stayed at the Adante Hotel from 7/29 thru 8/1 and were very impressed with the value of this budget hotel. I was somewhat skeptical and paranoid about the location being on the edge of the tenderloin district but the location turned out to be excellent. We hauled suitcases at 9:30 at night from the Powell Street Station up to the hotel with absolutely no problems. Had two teenager with us, quite an eye opener for them with all the hustle bustle and happenings on the street. The hotel itself was very clean, unique and friendly. I suppose you could pay the same and stay at a Holiday Inn but you would be experiencing cookie cutter boredom. Not so at the Adante. Our room was small but adequate and did I mention clean? Our room faced Geary so it was noisy if the windows were left open but we closed them at night and ran the ceiling fan and this was more than comfy and I sleep hot. The front desk was friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast is good enough to hold you over til you can get some real breakfast. Dont expect luxury, but for what you pay you will be more than pleasantly surprised!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booking a 1* hotel sight unseen can be a bit risky but we were delighted with our choice. We caught the BART from the airport to Powell St and wheeled our luggage to the Adante. Our plane arrived early in the morning but they have a luggage room for storing baggage when necessary. The room was small but clean, quiet and comfortable, which is all we ask in a hotel. The bus at the door goes to Golden Gate Park and y ou can walk to the cable cars and Union Square. Breakfast of muffins, toast, juice and coffee is enough to get you going for the day and the internet cafe right next door is very convenient. Would have no hesitation in staying here again.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in September and it was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: As we were in a city centre I asked for a room on a high floor in a quiet area. When we checked in we were given room 711. This is on the top floor (I think) and right at the back. The room was really quiet and just what we wanted.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew into town and got the BART train into the city. This was really easy and cheap $5.15 each and the hotel is only about a 5-10 walk from the train stop.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.text: If you do this I would however recommend you walk up Powell and along Geary st as opposed to taking a direct route from the train station to the hotel like we did. Unfortunately this takes you through the homeless area which wasn't too pretty.
reviews.title: Cute hotel! would stay here again.

likes.disliked: — The amount of homeless people outside

reviews.text: I was travelling alone so looking for somewhere safe, central and affordable. I booked the hotel on the basis of other Trip Advisor reviews so thought it was time to reciprocate. It is a nice hotel in a very central location. Five minute walk into Union Square, 10 mins to the cable car/metro. Yes, there are a quite a lot of homeless people on the street as you walk back from Union Square, but I never felt threatened by anyone.
reviews.title: Dolphins on the ceiling

likes.disliked: — walking back alone at night along geary street

reviews.title: Satisfactory
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, comfortable and friendly. The reception staff are very keen to help. Cleaners overenthusiastic so do remember to put the 'do not disturb' sign out at night. There is a good internet cafe downstairs which is also a relaxed place for a single traveller to enjoy a coffee or a beer. It is open until 9.30.

Rooms may be small by US standards but pretty standard for a European 2/3 star hotel. Perfect for a single traveller, but my room would have been ok for couples. I kept the curtains closed as I looked out directly into another window,but the room had very good lighting. And it was so quiet.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms get you out and about
For the adventurous, not for families
reviews.text: And there are dolphins, angel fish and Nemo in some of the rooms.........

Took a vacation to San Francisco July 19 - 22. Adante Hotel was where we stayed. It was a pretty small room but we were only there to sleep and take showers. For the budget, it was ok. The front desk clerks Mark & Tony were very helpful. The free continental breakfast was not so good, could be better. Had a problem with our sink but reported it to the maid and when we got back it was fixed. I had nightmares about the noise but we were put in the back on the second floor and it was very quiet. We even had our window open. I would stay again here when I go back to San Francisco. Very convenient to everything.
reviews.title: Good Budget Hotel
Great Value - Great Experience
reviews.text: My rating of "Above Average" is based on the value I got for my dollar. It's not a five star hotel, but it doesn't claim to be, either. It was clean, quiet and comfortable, which is all I care about when I'm spending most of my time exploring the city.

The rooms aren't huge, but there is adequate space to lay down your luggage and move around the room (the bathrooms were especially roomy, which my girlfriend appreciated). The beds were comfortable, and I didn't hear a peep from any of my neighbors. The staff was helful and friendly, which is always appreciated.
reviews.title: Great deal
Nice but...
reviews.text: Location was pretty good - somewhere between Chinatown and Japantown, which turned out to be the two places we spent most of our time. I didn't think the area was any worse or better than most places we visted. I did encounter a few homeless people within a few blocks of the hotel, but it seemed like there were homeless people everywhere I went and was therefore nothing out of the ordinary. If you stay anywhere downtown, it's going to be the same.

This is a great hotel for someone who isn't going to spend a lot of time there...i.e. there is no pool/spa/gym. However our room and bathroom were very clean. The staff were very nice and helpful. It was so close to Union Square (about 4 short blocks) and the start of the Cable Cars (a few streets down). My friend and I were even able to walk to Chinatown in 20 minutes but public transportation is right outside the door if you are not up for walking. There is a daily continental breakfast included in your stay and if you want something more there is a really cute cafe attached to the lobby. My friend and I took the airport shuttle from the hotel for $14 or you can catch the BART which is a few blocks away.
reviews.title: Bargain rates - okay stay
Bad Experience
reviews.text: All in all I thought this hotel was excellent for the $85/nt price tag right in the middle of the more expensive hotels. I am going to suggest it to everyone I know planning on visiting San Francisco.
excellent location, room had everything i wanted, bath/safe.except no kettle, only coffee maker, but not a big problem.
reviews.title: good quiet easy located hotel

likes.liked: — the quietness of the room location
likes.disliked: — no proper kettle in room, only coffeemaker and i dont drink coffee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room was quietly located. Initially i had booked this hotel for only 1 week, just in case i didn't like it, but because i was happy with room and location i decided to book another week and i didn't have to change room!
reviews.title: Good stay at the Adante

reviews.text: The Bed was very comfortable and had big TV. Room generally very clean.
reviews.title: Good value, but don't expect the Ritz

likes.liked: — Near all the action and the price
likes.disliked: — Only one small elevator for 7 floors of people

reviews.text: Staff pretty good, except on two occasions i managed to change travelers cheques, on the third another receptionist said they weren't allowed to, which is strange as the other receptionist did, especially as i thought travellerscheques were widely accepted in USA
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is an internet cafe right next door, which is also connected through the hotels reception.
reviews.title: Not again
Brilliant location
reviews.text: We were really pleased with the Adante hotel. The location is great - you are 5 minutes from Union Square and it is on a bus route and handy for cable cars too. You felt safe walking around the area day and night, important as we had a teenager with us. We had two rooms, painted with a jungle theme to put you in the holiday mood. Whilst the rooms were a little tired, they were clean and offer good value for money. Breakfast was pretty basic - toast and muffins, but stoked you up for a while. Tony on the front desk was really helpful and offered good advice about the city. The restaurant across the road from the hotel does lovely food and the internet cafe is handy for coffee and even more muffins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel didn't look particularly great on the websites I viewed but we wanted somewhere reasonable to stay. The hotel was excellent! The staff were friendly, the rooms were really clean and comfortable. There is a great little coffee shop/ internet cafe/ bar which was great for a quick coffee or drink in the afternoon. The location was ideal near the theatres and close to Union Square. Also plenty of taxis and, if you want to take the bus or trolley, the staff will point you in the correct direction.
reviews.title: Great Value! No complaints!

reviews.text: We stayed for 6 nights; we just had one problem, which was the toilet flooding on our first night. The hotel staff were really good took care of it straight away when we reported it. The rooms were reasonably clean (mould on the carpet near the radiator); there was no air con only a fan on the ceiling could do with some modernisation. Hotel staff were really friendly, I think the place is ok considering what you pay.
reviews.title: It's an OK hotel

reviews.text: The Adante was in a good location, within walking distance to Union Square, only downside is there are quite a few homeless people nearby who beg for money but they don't pose any real threat. There is bus stop right outside the hotel that heads down to Union Square. If I return to San Francisco I would stay here again.
reviews.title: clean budget hotel

reviews.text: Just returned and thought the folks at the Adante deserved some well earned praise. Exceptionally clean rooms, everything was quite spotless. The rooms were a little small, we ( a family of 4 with 10,12 year olds) were a little squashed, but not horribly. We got upgraded to their junior suite and the kids did fine in the pull out sofa. I always do a spot inspection when getting to a hotel ( toilets, lights, tv, etc) and this place passed wonderfully. We stayed for four nights, got a late c/o and still paid only $500.US. total. That qualifies as a good bargain in San Fran. Nobody mentioned that there was a laundry mat next door for families with kids. The free muffins in the morning were tasty, and the oj was a nice touch. Staff were pleasant and helpful, a great place that was certainly a great deal. Well done, Adante !!
reviews.title: Not bad budget hotel
lovely clean hotel, nice staff
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel after reading many reviews and in my opinion it is not a bad hotel. The good points are:
*price and value is good if you're on a budget.
reviews.title: You know what, it's really an ok hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel is in a transitional area, the Tendloin/Nob Hill area. I felt safe, the room was as pictured on the website and EXCEPTIONALLY clean. The bathroom was as clean as can be! The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly, courteous, helpful. They printed tourist resources directly for me from the internet. Continental breakfast was white bread toast, coffee, store bought muffins. For the price in San Fran, the cleanliness, and the hospitality of all staff, I would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Would stay again and again!

likes.disliked: — Rug was dirty in my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a pleasant 4 nite stay at the Adante and read some very uneven reviews.For the money you know that you should lower your expectations, having said that front desk staff were always courteous
reviews.title: not so bad

likes.disliked: — cont breakfast hotel on the warm side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and helpful, housekeeping was always on top of things, rooms done everyday and done right. We had the park and room rate and with the transit system in that town you don't need your vechile to get around. If you book a room at the back of the hotel away from the road we found it was quieter. But if people in the next room talk in loud voices early in the morning and late at nite, bang their door closed when they are coming and going, it doesn't really matter. As far as the area is concerned maybe not the best area in San Fran, but you could easily spend two or three times the money and stay in a upscale hotel a block or two away but your still in the same area with the same homeless people it is not just around the Adante! Skip the continental and go to Dotties or the Crepe house.
reviews.title: If you want clean and basic.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have previously stayed at the sister hotel, The York, and had a pleasant stay, so we thought we would give the Adante a try.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: This is an old fashioned, mid sized hotel in a good central location. The staff were very friendly, and the hotel was clean.
reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location but that's where the fun stops. Horrible check-in experience.....after 14 hours direct from Sydney the clerk refused to give us a room at 10:30 am because checkin starts at 3:00 pm, even though he agreed that rooms were available. $20 cash fixed that little problem. Worst thing was the breakfast. No actual dining room so guests have to crowd around an alcove off the lobby with their crummy rations of self-serve white bread toast with jam and tea, coffee, juice etc. (Then walk downtown and pay to have a real breakfast). No bar, Internet cafe, business facilities....or anything really. Just the room.
reviews.title: Faulty Towers comes to Frisco

reviews.text: stayed for 9 nights. great price for a decent place just several blocks away from Union Square, shopping malls, BART, etc. TV was old but servicable and offered cable with no snowflakes. Room was tight but manageable...was only a place to store things and sleep. Restroom could be upgraded but still clean. Continental breakfast in lobby free. Had free internet access in room (cable). Great front desk help. Signed up city tours and shuttle service to airport thru front desk. If walking around late at night...stay on main road (Geary) dont stray off to side alley streets. Area is close "ghetto" area. Usually don't bother you but you never know what will happen.
reviews.title: Great deal for boutique hotel blocks away from Union Square

likes.liked: — Clean, downtown area but not downtown prices!

reviews.text: Though it's on the edge of a sketchy area, the Adante is pretty good, considering its place on the hierarchy of hotels. The standard rooms aren't very big, but they're just big enough for two. The bathrooms were renovated - nice and clean. The decor was pretty nice, and so were the linens. The people at the front desk were all nice and helpful. I kinda liked the mural on the wall. And the breakfast was enough to tide you over until lunch.
reviews.title: I Agree - It's Fine

likes.disliked: — ice machine didn't work, no fitness room

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: It was a busy weekend (Nike Women's Marathon) and prices were through the roof at many places, so we were happy to stay at the Adante for a fairly reasonable $89 rate. I'd rather pay less, but I also didn't want to pay $300+ for a 3 or 4*.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were also a little worried about some of the bad reviews, but on this trip to the city we were extremely budget conscious and only needed a one night stay anyway. It is an old hotel, however, our bathroom was brand new, squeaky clean with jacuzzi tub, and the room itself was squeaky clean. Frankly, the bathroom newness/cleanliness and room cleanliness is what really matters to me anyway. So we were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed the brief stay.
reviews.title: Don't worry, it's OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as it was fairly cheap and although it had some mixed reviews we thought we'd give it a try. That was a mistake! The hotel reception is nice, however when you get up to the rooms thats a different story. My bed sheets had cigarette burns, the carpets were filthy and on the last night I shared my bed with some bed bugs! The location of the hotel was good since it was near to Union Square, however if you turn right & walk up the street its a pretty scary neighbour. Overall the hotel spoiled our trip to San Francisco, I'm just glad we were only there for 3 days, I couldn't have lasted any longer.
reviews.title: Horrible Dirty Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed there for 2 nights and had a great time. The room had hand-painted pictures of dolphins on the wall which was really neat. Besides, the room and bathroom was very clean and comfortable, JUST PERFECT!!!!!!! We just loved it!!!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had many questions about public transportations and got them all answered very friendly and patient.
reviews.title: G-R-E-A-T!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel with a friendly and helfull staff. The situation in the city is great, very close to Union Square.
reviews.title: Great value!

likes.disliked: — Many homeless persons in the neighborhood

reviews.text: Rooms are not very big, but it is enough. The street is a liitle noisy.
reviews.title: great little hotel for cheap price

reviews.text: Don't expect too much at the breakfast, it is free but just coffe/tea, orange juice, muffins, and bread with marmelade and butter. It was ok for us, but there is many places in the neighborhood to have great ones.
reviews.title: Adante is my go-to hotel in SF now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An older style hotel but in a great location. Rooms were clean and good size. Hotel staff were very good and the price is right for San Francisco.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will stay again without any problems.
reviews.title: Good deal, would return for sure!

description: The Adante Hotel is a premier boutique hotel located in the heart of San Francisco, just three blocks from Union Square, cable cars, theatres and world class fine dining. Catering to both business and pleasure travelers, the Adante boasts a residential influence, a romantic setting and deluxe amenities like high speed Internet in every room. The Adante Hotel's 93 guest rooms are charmingly appointed and each is adorned with original hand painted European style murals.
